meanings.definition: Tendency to scatter or spread widely
meanings.sent1: The dispersiveness of the seeds allowed them to be carried far by the wind.
meanings.sent2: The dispersiveness of the paint made it challenging to control where it landed.
meanings.sent3: The dispersiveness of the glitter on the craft project created a sparkly mess.
meanings.sent4: Her dispersiveness in sharing secrets earned her the nickname 'Gossip Queen'.
meanings.sent5: The dispersiveness of the fireworks lit up the night sky in a beautiful display.

meanings.definition: Quality of being prone to disperse or distribute widely
meanings.sent1: The dispersiveness of the rumors led to confusion among the students.
meanings.sent2: The dispersiveness of the pollen caused allergies to flare up in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The dispersiveness of the spilled marbles made them roll in all directions.
meanings.sent4: His dispersiveness in sharing resources made him a popular team member.
meanings.sent5: The dispersiveness of the scent from the bakery drew customers in from blocks away.
